definition: South China Morning Post (newspaper in Hong Kong)

sentences.english: You get up in the morning and put on your glasses, snap on the radio, and grab the morning paper.
sentences.chinese: 你在早上醒来，戴上眼镜，打开收音机，拿起早报。

sentences.english: The writer is an executive reporter of Zaobao.
sentences.chinese: 作者是《联合早报》执行级记者。

sentences.english: The third party company possibly propagandizes their product or the service in the morning paper website.
sentences.chinese: 第三方公司可能在早报网站宣传他们的产品或服务。

sentences.english: The paper will appear in the journal's Online Early Edition this week.
sentences.chinese: 报告会在这周本期刊的在线早报上出现。

sentences.english: The writer is a correspondent with the Political Desk, Lianhe Zaobao.
sentences.chinese: 作者是《联合早报》政治组执行级记者。

sentences.english: Many Chinese undergraduates still find reading the Lianhe Zaobao difficult.
sentences.chinese: 许多华族大学生还是连阅读《联合早报》都很累。

sentences.english: The writer is a Specialist Writer of Lianhe Zaobao.
sentences.chinese: 作者是联合早报的一位专栏作家。

sentences.english: A woman called Ai, who lives in the female toilets, told the Zhejiang Morning Express: "We have got used to the strong smell of urine.
sentences.chinese: 一个名叫嫒的女人住在女厕里面，浙江早报报道说。

sentences.english: In Britain it is a custom for a newsagent to hire boys and girls to deliver the morning papers.
sentences.chinese: 在英国，报刊批发商习惯将投递早报的任务交给报童。

sentences.english: The dinner is regarded as the most expensive reunion dinner in China, the Singapore-based Lianhe Zaobao reported Monday.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡《联合早报》报道称，该年夜饭可谓中国最贵。

sentences.english: Lianhe Zaobao today has a readership of over 800,000.
sentences.chinese: 《联合早报》目前的读者群已超过80万人。

sentences.english: The writer is Lianhe Zaobao's art journalist.
sentences.chinese: 作者是《联合早报》文化艺术记者。

sentences.english: I am applying for the position advertised in the morning newspaper by your company yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 我来应征昨天早报上贵公司要招聘的空缺职位。

sentences.english: The Post said production had been halted for five days at the plant.
sentences.chinese: 南华早报说，生产已经停止5天了。

sentences.english: I apply for the vacant position which your company recruited on morning paper yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 我来应征昨天早报上贵公司要招聘的空缺职位。

sentences.english: The writer is Assistant Editor ( Business Desk ), Lianhe Zaobao Poh .
sentences.chinese: 作者是早报财经组助理主任。

definition: evening newspaper/(in a newspaper's name) Evening News
morning newspaper/(in a newspaper's name) Morning Post
Toutiao, personalized content recommendation app (abbr. for 今日頭條|今日头条[Jin1 ri4 Tou2 tiao2])
restricted document, available only to certain individuals such as high-ranking Party officials (abbr. for 內部參考|内部参考)/(literary) palace eunuch
